original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares edge down in mid day trade
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edged down in stagnant conditions in mid day trade on Friday, however the financial sector is seeing some positive gains as debt restructuring and optimization have been assured, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.06 percent or 4.94 points to 8,944.88, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.28 percent or 7.32 points to 2,596.60.
Top losers during mid day trade were Lanka IOC, Expolanka and Dialog Axiata.

Analysts said that, Lanka IOC was loosing due to falling retail prices despite recording good profits, Expolanka was down on poor earnings reports and Dialog Axiata is witnessing profit taking on merging news with Airtel. (Colombo/May12/2023)
